qas.question: Which republic did not sign the Alma-Ata Protocol?
How many of the former republics had representatives sign the Protocol?
What was dissolved by the Protocol?
Which news organization did Gorbachev talk to about his resignation plans?

context: Doubts remained over the authority of the Belavezha Accords to disband the Soviet Union, since they were signed by only three republics. However, on December 21, 1991, representatives of <a1_0>11<a1_0/> of the 12 former republics – all except <a0_0>Georgia<a0_0/> – signed the Alma-Ata Protocol, which confirmed the dissolution of the <a3_0>Union<a3_0/> and formally established the CIS. They also "accepted" Gorbachev's resignation. While Gorbachev hadn't made any formal plans to leave the scene yet, he did tell <a4_0>CBS<a4_0/> News that he would resign as soon as he saw that the <a2_0>CIS<a2_0/> was indeed a reality.
